meta.label: CONF_MESSAGE[FS Mount]
meta.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Mount a remote location on the file system before accessing the repository]

param.name: FILESYSTEM_TYPE
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[FS Type]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Filesystem Type, will be used for the -t option of the mount command]

param.name: MOUNT_SUDO
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Sudo]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Call the mount/umount commands through sudo, must be configured on the server]

param.name: UNC_PATH
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Remote Path]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Path to the remote share to mount, use //123.456.789.654/path you can use AJXP_USER]

param.name: MOUNT_OPTIONS
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Mount Options]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Used with the -o command option, use AJXP_USER, AJXP_PASS, AJXP_SERVER_UID, AJXP_SERVER_GID]

param.name: MOUNT_ENV_PASSWD
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Pass Password via environment instead of command line]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Instead of setting password through the AJXP_PASS variable in mount options, pass it through the environment variables. Sudo file must be changed accordingly.]

param.name: MOUNT_RESULT_SUCCESS
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Additional result codes to accept as success]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[On some setup result code 32 is often an already mounted code and we want to consider this as a success. Add comma-separated list of codes.]

param.name: REMOVE_MOUNTPOINT_ON_UNMOUNT
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Remove mount point on unmount]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Delete mount folder on unmount. Can be required for security reasons.]
